head.supplied: Oct 23 /66 ¶ Dear Hector ¶ ¶ Yours of 17 Aug to hand with enclosures see note on back of this. ¶ ¶ I have paid £14 to R.S. entrance fee & 1st year subscription & shall apply to your Edinburgh friend...

div.p: Hector papers, Museum of New Zealand, Wellington.
Yours of 17 Aug to hand with enclosures see note on back of this.
I have paid £14 to R.S. entrance fee & 1st year subscription & shall apply to your Edinburgh friend for the same.

We shall try hard for Haast this session & hope to succeed — I am particularly glad that you came off first & at once. It is as well, as you say, that Haast should feel that FRS is not so cheap as German cross & ribbons.

I hope he will not go off like Mueller with unappeasable & insatiable vanity & love of personal distinction which is grievous in so good a man — I have to lecture him like a child. Haast seems a capital man for R.S. & I have little doubt of his success.

Thanks for franking Colensos very valuable boxes the Kumeras came in fair order, the others all dead I fear I cannot write to him by this Marseilles, having an awful pile to answer etc. being off to Wales to see D. Lyall for 4 or 5 days.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Lyall is at Pembroke Dock & has married a very nice wife.
